summary: H.R. 335, titled the "Repeal the NFA Act," was introduced in the House of Representatives by Mr. Burlison and several cosponsors. The bill's sole purpose is to repeal the National Firearms Act (NFA) by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. If passed, this would eliminate the federal taxes and registration requirements for firearms and accessories currently regulated under the NFA, such as machine guns, short-barreled rifles, short-barreled shotguns, and silencers. The bill has been referred to the Committee on Ways and Means.
